data.title: Dr. Efrain Jonckheer - Curaçao History
data.meta_description: CuracaoHistory.com strives to have a positive impact on the life of our citizens by making our island's history easily and freely accessible to anyone who has a computer or smartphone and an internet connection.
data.text: Dr. Efrain Jonckheer was the founder of the DP (Democratic Party). In 1944 he became a member of the Parliament of the Netherlands Antilles. Dr. Jonckheer participated in the Round Table Conferences as a member of the Antillean delegation. He was closely involved in the preparations for the realization of the “Statuut” (Charter). On 8 December 1954, he became Prime Minister of the Netherlands Antilles and a week after that he signed the “Statuut voor het Koninkrijk” (Charter for the Kingdom). Dr. Jonckheer was Prime Minister of four coalitions that formed the government of the Netherlands Antilles.
